title: Alice Waters and the Farm-to-Table Movement
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Alice Waters and the Farm-to-Table Movement.

hook.text: In 1971, Alice Waters opened Chez Panisse in Berkeley with one rule: every ingredient must be local and seasonal.

buildup.text: At a time of TV dinners and canned vegetables, she insisted on relationships with local farmers.

punchline.text: She didn't invent farm-to-table. She just reminded America it was the original.
